meanings.definition: The quality of being closely connected or appropriate to the matter at hand.
meanings.sent1: The relevancy of the evidence in the case was crucial for the verdict.
meanings.sent2: She questioned the relevancy of his comments during the meeting.
meanings.sent3: The relevancy of wearing a swimsuit to a snowball fight seemed absurd.
meanings.sent4: His relevancy to the team was like a missing puzzle piece.
meanings.sent5: The relevancy of safety precautions became evident after the accident.

meanings.definition: The degree to which something is pertinent or applicable.
meanings.sent1: The relevancy of her experience to the job requirements was impressive.
meanings.sent2: He doubted the relevancy of the old data to the current study.
meanings.sent3: The relevancy of using a fork to eat soup made everyone chuckle.
meanings.sent4: The relevancy of time in a crisis is like a ticking clock.
meanings.sent5: The relevancy of the map became clear as they reached the crossroads.

meanings.definition: The state of being relevant or significant.
meanings.sent1: The relevancy of his role in the project was undeniable.
meanings.sent2: She emphasized the relevancy of the topic in today's discussion.
meanings.sent3: The relevancy of a clown at a funeral would be quite odd.
meanings.sent4: The relevancy of her words echoed in his mind like a haunting melody.
meanings.sent5: The relevancy of the discovery changed the course of history.
